column5: it's only the 2nd time I've seen one, I googled it and figured it out, the little guy is about the size of a toonie, that's Bee Balm if your familiar with the plant, the pictures aren't the best  any guesses?
I've seen these before and have always wondered what they were. Seems they don't have the body shape of a Hummingbird - unless it is another variety. Will be interested in their identity.
pretty cool little beasts, they're not shy either, you can get up close no problem
From what i understand the hummingbird moth is the adult of those huge green caterpillars that devour half a tomato plant in one night.
Hummingbird moth - one of the neatest bugs ever!  Here are some of my photos taken this year:  http://www.flickr.com/photos/91080279@N05/sets/72157635081256141/   Jon
Those shots are spectacular! Well done.
Most awesome moth ever.   Mothman prophecies.
just frigging great....now im afraid of moths....where do i turn my man card in ?  Nice shots Jon!
